headline.main: CALIFORNIA.; DETAILS FROM FRASER'S RIVER. INTERESTING FROM THE SANDWICH ISLANDS, The Indian War in Oregon and Washington. Events and Incidents on the Pacific Coast. ADVICES A FORTNIGHT LATER. $1,434,674 in Gold Dust. ARRIVAL OF THE MOSES TAYLOR.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Moses Taylor, JOHN McGOWAN, Esq., Commanding, from Aspinwall on the 19th inst., vid Key West, with mails, passengers and treasure brought down by the Pacitic Mail steamship Sonora, from San Francisco on the 5th inst., arrived at this post yesterday afternoon. The Moses Taylor found U. S. brig Dolphin, Lieuterant Commanding MAFFITT, at Key West on 231 inst. She was to sail next morning for the north.

docs.snippet: Another evidence of the practical working value of the Atlantic Telegraph is furnished in our telegraphic column. A dispatch, communicating the terms of the Treaty consummated by the French and English Plenipotentiaries at Tiensin, reached us...
docs.lead_paragraph: Another evidence of the practical working value of the Atlantic Telegraph is furnished in our telegraphic column. A dispatch, communicating the terms of the Treaty consummated by the French and English Plenipotentiaries at Tiensin, reached us yesterday at noon, derived from the London papers of yesterday morning. It is also stated that the information it contains was only received at St. Petersburg on the 21st inst.

docs.snippet: THE HON. JOSHUA R. GIDDINGS.--The fact is communicated by telegraph that JOHN HUTCHINGS has been nominated for Congress by the Republicans of GIDDINGS' district. This would seem to imply that Mr. G. is to retire from public life. Whether his failure...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE HON. JOSHUA R. GIDDINGS.--The fact is communicated by telegraph that JOHN HUTCHINGS has been nominated for Congress by the Republicans of GIDDINGS' district. This would seem to imply that Mr. G. is to retire from public life. Whether his failure to be renominated is according to his wish, is not stated. Probably it is ; for his influence in his district is understood to be unbounded.

headline.main: Letter from Mr. Bryant.; DEATH OF HELEN RUTHVEN WATERSTON.

docs.snippet: We have at last some practical results of the Atlantic Cable. The first news dispatch reached us yesterday . But for the primitive habits of the Nova Scotian telegraphers, who retire to bed at 9 o'clock, we should have been able to present the...
docs.lead_paragraph: We have at last some practical results of the Atlantic Cable. The first news dispatch reached us yesterday . But for the primitive habits of the Nova Scotian telegraphers, who retire to bed at 9 o'clock, we should have been able to present the telegram to the readers of the TIMES yesterday morning, so that the period of communication would have been brought within barely four hours.

docs.snippet: CYRUS W. FIFLD, Esq., yesterday, before 12 o'clock, received a dispatch from SAMUEL GURNEY, Esq., Chairman of the Atlantie Telegraph Company, which had been forwarded from Valentia during the forenoon. It was simply congratulatory, but worth notice...
docs.lead_paragraph: CYRUS W. FIFLD, Esq., yesterday, before 12 o'clock, received a dispatch from SAMUEL GURNEY, Esq., Chairman of the Atlantie Telegraph Company, which had been forwarded from Valentia during the forenoon. It was simply congratulatory, but worth notice as an indication of the progress made by the electricians in their experinents, as it only occupied two hours in the transit.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Shall the Contract System be Adopted ? CENTRAL PARK. Police Intelligence. MAYOR'S OFFICE. KILLED BY FALLING FROM A CART. SUPREME COURT

docs.lead_paragraph: REPORT OF THE MAJORITY. The Special Committee to whom was referred a resolution of this Board "to inquire and report whether any work, and if so what work, can be advantageously conducted by contract instead of day's work," Respectfully report: That they have given the subject careful attention,

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH, WEDNESDAY-At the meeting of the Board this day, the Health officer reported the arrival of the steamers Alabama and Huntsville from Savannah. He said that it had been indirectly reported to him, within the past two days that...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH, WEDNESDAY-At the meeting of the Board this day, the Health officer reported the arrival of the steamers Alabama and Huntsville from Savannah. He said that it had been indirectly reported to him, within the past two days that yellow fever was prevailing to a slight extent at savannah; that he had taken pains to ascertain the truth of these reports,
